name: counting exercise
info:
The counting exercise consists of taking a
route of your own choosing and counting forms of diversity on that route (number of people
with walking sticks, walkers, wheelchairs, touch sticks, mobility scooters, assistance dogs ...).

name: The Quiz
info:
In the quiz, questions are asked related to mental and physical diversity, building on the
counting exercise (example question: how many people are in a wheelchair in the
Netherlands? About 1 in 110 people, who you don't see on the street)

name: Safari
info:
In the safari, the environment is experienced with a blindfold, in a wheelchair, an old-age
simulation suit or other ways.

name: Game element linked to digital platform for help on the go
info:
For level 4 and 5 it is still too early. Because a digital platform for help on the road is still
under development, in which in the future people on that platform will be randomly linked
on that platform on the way through the city in public transport and public space, linking
supply and demand of help on the way. For example, if a traveler meets a blind fellow
traveler to guide him/her through the station, a game element can also be linked to this
encounter

name: Feedback after help
info:
For level 4 and 5 it is still too early. Because a digital platform for help on the road is still
under development, in which in the future people on that platform will be randomly linked
on that platform on the way through the city in public transport and public space, linking
supply and demand of help on the way. For example, if a traveler meets a blind fellow
traveler to guide him/her through the station, a game element can also be linked to this
encounter

name: Final Boss!!
info:
Level 6 is the most exciting thing. In the previous levels, players earn credits. This creates a
ranking of players. Every so often, the highest scoring players are allowed to visit a final boss
(a member of the city council or the GMT, municipal management team, with the mayor as
the ultimate boss). In level 6, the player, together with an experienced expert met in the
game, can try to convince the final boss of a change for inclusion. In this way, user
experience can end up at the municipal top in a playful way, who can then make more
inclusive choices.
